articles.title: DPRK aerial acrobatics places first at international festival
articles.content:
DPRK aerial acrobatics places first at international festival 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The small group of the Pyongyang circus won the prize of the President of the Republic of France, the highest prize of the festival, and the aerial acrobatics "flying girls" the first prize at the 9th Massay International Circus Festival held in Massay city, France from Jan. 25 to 28.
 Aerial acrobatics "duet swinging" received a technical prize.

DPRK book wing opens
articles.content:
DPRK book wing opens 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK book wing of the 33rd Cairo international book fair was opened on January 24.
 On display in the wing were famous works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, books on their immortal exploits, picture albums, magazines and other DPRK books and handicrafts.    
 The fair was participated in by 85 countries including the DPRK and 15 international organizations.

Paek Nam Sun meets new Equatorial Guinean ambassador
articles.content:
Paek Nam Sun meets new Equatorial Guinean ambassador 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, met Manuel Moto Tomo, new Equatorial Guinean ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him today.

articles.title: Kim Il Chol meets Cuban ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Il Chol meets Cuban ambassador 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, met Jose Manuel Inclan Embade, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
